item.title: Banana bread
item.description:
ğŸŒ Easy Air-Fryer Banana Bread

â­ Ingredients

  • 2 ripe bananas
  • 1 egg
  • 3 tbsp melted butter (or oil)
  • 1/3 cup sugar (use 1/4 cup for less sweetness)
  • 1 cup plain flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • Optional:
    • 1 tsp vanilla
    • Chocolate chips or chopped nuts
    • 1/2 tsp cinnamon

ğŸ Equipment

  • Air fryer
  • Small loaf pan (heat-safe for air fryers)
  • Baking paper or cooking spray

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

1. Prep the pan

  • Line or grease a small loaf pan.
  • Preheat the air fryer to 160Â°C (320Â°F).

2. Mix the wet ingredients

  • Mash the bananas in a bowl.
  • Add the egg, melted butter, sugar, and vanilla.
  • Mix until smooth.

3. Add the dry ingredients

  • Stir in the flour, baking powder, and salt.
  • Mix gently until just combined.
  • Add optional chocolate chips or nuts if using.

4. Fill the pan

  • Pour the batter into the loaf pan.
  • Tap lightly to remove air bubbles.

5. Air-fry

  • Cook at 160Â°C (320Â°F) for 20â€“25 minutes.
  • Check with a toothpick: if it comes out clean, it’s done.
  • If browning too quickly, cover the top loosely with foil halfway through.

6. Cool and enjoy

  • Let the banana bread rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
  • Enjoy warm or at room temperature!

ğŸ§ Optional Variations

  • Chocolate Chip Banana Bread: Add 1/2 cup chocolate chips.
  • Cinnamon Swirl: Add a layer of cinnamon + sugar in the middle.
  • Nutty Banana Bread: Add 1/3 cup chopped walnuts or pecans.

item.description:

(Servings: 3â€“4)

item.title: Refried Bean Taco
item.description:
ğŸŒ® Refried Bean Tacos with Queso Fresco & Mexican Salsa

A hearty, high-fiber vegetarian taco made with creamy refried beans, soft tortillas, and fresh queso fresco.
Optional salsa adds a zesty touch!

ğŸ›’ Grocery List (Serves 2 â€“ 4 tacos)

For the refried beans

  • 1 cup cooked pinto beans (or 1 can, drained and rinsed)
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 small onion, finely chopped
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • Â½ tsp ground cumin
  • Salt to taste
  • Â¼ cup water or broth

For the tortillas

  • 4 small corn or flour tortillas
  • Â½ tsp olive oil (for warming)

For the queso fresco (optional)

  • 100 g queso fresco or crumbly feta (if unavailable)
  • Optional: pinch of salt and lime juice

Optional Mexican salsa

  • 1 medium tomato, chopped
  • Â½ small onion, finely chopped
  • 1 jalapeÃ±o or green chili, finely diced
  • 1 tbsp fresh coriander (cilantro), chopped
  • Juice of Â½ lime
  • Salt to taste

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ³ Meal Prep & Instructions

1. Prepare the Refried Beans

  1. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
  2. Add chopped onion and sautÃ© until translucent (about 3â€“4 min).
  3. Add minced garlic and cook 30 seconds.
  4. Add the cooked beans, cumin, and salt.
  5. Mash with a fork or potato masher while stirring.
  6. Add a little water or broth until creamy.
  7. Simmer for 5â€“7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  8. Adjust salt and set aside.

2. Prepare the Queso Fresco (Optional)

  1. Crumble queso fresco or feta into small pieces.
  2. Toss with a few drops of lime juice and a pinch of salt.
  3. Chill until serving.

3. Make the Salsa (Optional)

  1. Combine chopped tomato, onion, chili, and coriander in a bowl.
  2. Add lime juice and salt to taste.
  3. Mix and let rest 10 minutes for flavors to develop.

4. Warm the Tortillas

  1. Heat a pan over medium heat.
  2. Add a drop of olive oil and warm each tortilla for ~30 seconds per side until soft and lightly golden.

5. Assemble the Tacos

  1. Spread 2â€“3 tbsp of refried beans onto each warm tortilla.
  2. Top with crumbled queso fresco (optional).
  3. Spoon fresh salsa on top.
  4. Fold and serve immediately.

ğŸ½ï¸ Nutrition Information (per taco, without salsa)

Component Amount
Calories ~210 kcal
Protein 9 g
Carbohydrates 25 g
Fat 8 g
Fiber 6 g
Sodium Moderate (depends on salt & cheese)

With queso fresco and salsa: +60 kcal, +4 g protein, +2 g fat.

item.title: Air fryer roasted chicken
item.description:
ğŸ”¥ Air Fryer Roast Chicken (Whole Bird)

Hereâ€™s a simple, reliable way to roast a whole chicken in an air fryerâ€”crispy skin, juicy meat, minimal effort.

â­ What Youâ€™ll Need

  • 1 whole chicken (1.2â€“1.8 kg fits most air fryers)
  • 1â€“2 tbsp olive oil (or melted butter)
  • Salt & pepper
  • Optional extras: paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, rosemary, lemon

ğŸ§‚ Quick Seasoning Mix (optional)

Mix:

  • 1 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • Â½ tsp onion powder
  • Â½â€“1 tsp salt
  • Â½ tsp black pepper
  • Â½ tsp dried thyme

Rub this all over after oiling the chicken.

item.title: Air fryer salmon with asparagus
item.description:
Air Fryer Salmon + Asparagus Tips

A quick, simple method to cook both salmon and asparagus tips together in the air fryer.

Ingredients (2 servings)

  • 2 salmon fillets (150â€“200 g each)
  • 200 g asparagus tips
  • 1â€“2 tsp olive oil
  • Salt + pepper

Optional seasonings

  • Lemon juice or slices
  • Paprika, garlic powder, chilli flakes
  • Butter for finishing
  • Fresh herbs (dill, parsley, thyme)

Instructions

1. Prep the salmon

  1. Pat salmon dry.
  2. Rub lightly with olive oil.
  3. Season with salt, pepper, and optional paprika/garlic powder.
  4. Add lemon slices on top if using.

2. Prep the asparagus

  1. Toss asparagus in a bowl with a drizzle of olive oil.
  2. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Optional: Add minced garlic or a squeeze of lemon.

3. Air fry

  1. Preheat air fryer to 190Â°C (375Â°F) for 3â€“4 minutes.
  2. Place salmon fillets skin-side down in the basket.
  3. Add the asparagus tips around the salmon.
  4. Cook 8â€“10 minutes total.

Tip: Start checking from 8 minutes.
Salmon should flake easily and reach 52â€“55Â°C (125â€“130Â°F) for medium.
Asparagus should be tender-crisp and bright green.

item.title: Ground beef with potatoes, Mexican style
item.description:
ğŸŒ¶ï¸ Ground Beef with Potatoes & Mexican Chiles

A spicy, saucy, high-protein meal prep for 3 days.

ğŸ›’ Ingredients (for 4 servings â€“ scaled for 3-day meal prep below)

  • 500 g ground beef (10â€“15% fat)
  • 2 medium potatoes, diced
  • 3 medium tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 medium onion, diced
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 1 ancho chile
  • 1 guajillo chile
  • 1 chipotle in adobo + 1 tsp adobo sauce
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • Â½ tsp smoked paprika
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Salt & pepper
  • 1 tbsp oil

ğŸ”¥ FULL RECIPE (4 servings)

1. Chile Sauce

  1. Remove stems/seeds from ancho & guajillo.
  2. Toast 10â€“15 sec each side.
  3. Soak in hot water 10 min.
  4. Blend with:
    • garlic
    • chipotle + adobo
    • cumin, oregano, paprika
    • 1 cup water/stock
    • pinch salt
    • optional 1 tsp vinegar/lime
  5. Strain if you want it smoother.

2. Cook the Dish

  1. Brown beef in oil.
  2. Add onion â†’ cook 3â€“4 min.
  3. Add garlic â†’ 30 sec.
  4. Add potatoes â†’ cook 5 min.
  5. Add tomatoes â†’ soften 3â€“5 min.
  6. Add chile sauce + bay leaf.
  7. Simmer 20â€“25 min until potatoes are tender.
  8. Adjust salt, acidity, or thickness.

ğŸ± MEAL PREP FOR 3 DAYS

3 meals = 3 servings

item.title: Mexican dhal
item.description:
ğŸŒ¶ï¸ Spicy Potato Dhal with Guajillo, Ancho & Chipotle

One-Pot â€¢ Mexicanâ€“Indian Fusion â€¢ Serves 2â€“3

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

Lentils & Potatoes

  • 1 cup red lentils, rinsed
  • 2 medium potatoes, peeled & diced
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced (or add to puree)
  • 1â€“2 tsp ginger, grated
  • 1 tomato, chopped (or add to puree)
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • 1.5 tsp ground cumin
  • 1.5 tsp ground coriander
  • 1â€“2 tsp chilli powder
  • Â½ tsp crushed chilli flakes
  • Â½ tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp garam masala
  • 1â€“2 tbsp oil
  • 3â€“3.5 cups water
  • 1 tsp salt, adjust to taste

Mexican Chilli Puree

  • 1 guajillo chilli, destemmed & deseeded
  • Â½â€“1 ancho chilli, destemmed & deseeded
  • Â½â€“1 chipotle chilli in adobo, chopped
  • Hot water (for soaking)

ğŸ”¥ Instructions

1. Prepare the Mexican chilli puree

  1. Heat a dry pan over medium heat.
  2. Toast the guajillo and ancho pieces for 10â€“15 seconds per side until fragrant.
  3. Transfer them to a bowl and cover with hot water.
  4. Soak for 10 minutes until soft.
  5. Add the softened chillies to a blender with:
    • 2â€“3 tbsp soaking liquid
    • The chipotle
    • (Optional) garlic and tomato for a smoother base
  6. Blend until very smooth.
  7. Set aside.

2. SautÃ© the aromatics

  1. Heat 1â€“2 tbsp oil in a pot over medium heat.
  2. Add chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes.
  3. Add ginger and cook 30 seconds.
  4. If not blended into the puree, add garlic and tomato and cook a minute more.

3. Fry the Mexican chilli puree

  1. Pour the chilli puree into the pot.
  2. Cook for 2â€“3 minutes, stirring, until it darkens and thickens slightly.

4. Add the Indian spices

Add and cook for 30â€“45 seconds:

item.title: Vegetable broth
item.description:
ğŸ¥• Simple Homemade Vegetable Broth + What To Do With the Vegetables After

â­ Ingredients (makes 1.5â€“2 L broth)

  • 2 carrots
  • 2 celery stalks
  • 1 onion
  • 3 garlic cloves (optional)
  • 1â€“2 bay leaves
  • 6â€“8 peppercorns
  • Small handful of parsley (optional)
  • Salt (added at the end)
  • 2 litres water

Optional add-ins

  • Mushroom stems
  • Leek tops
  • Tomato ends
  • A small piece of ginger
  • Corn cobs

ğŸ² Instructions

1) Prep the vegetables

Wash everything (no peeling needed).
Cut into large chunks.
